body: Thanks again @szetszwo and @amaliujia for the review.
Question: shouldn't pre-vote is always a good optimization? Is there a situation that it is not suitable thus needs to be disabled?

@amaliujia Please see here.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51938049/105779415-4cf26d80-5fa9-11eb-843e-accbd613c5cf.png)
Thanks for explanation! Indeed for larger system it is better to benchmark such changes before adopting it.

Overall LGTM.

We can discuss what could be the default value.
@szetszwo @amaliujia Thanks for review. I have merged the patch.

+1 
@elek  thanks for kicking this off!
LGTM
@elek Thanks the patch. @amaliujia Thanks for review. I have merged it.
@elek Thanks the patch. @arp7 @amaliujia Thanks for review. I have merged it.

@szetszwo @umamaheswararao Could you help review this ? Thanks a lot.
@szetszwo Thanks the suggestions. I have updated this patch,  and also updated the generated asf-site in pr: https://github.com/apache/incubator-ratis/pull/406
@szetszwo Hi, Can I merge this ? This is only generated code.
Because code of asf-site-source has been merged, this patch only about generated code, so I marge it.

R: @runzhiwang @szetszwo 

This is the step 1 to support learner in Ratis. The goal is to make sure during leader election, candidates won't request votes from learners.
LGTM thanks!
@alpapad would you mind creating a JIRA for this PR?

I guess this will worth an email to user@ratis to ask the problem you are facing.

I don't think Ratis cannot handle larger than 8MB files transferred well. There is an example in Ratis repo named FileStore. You can use that example to save files by an application based on Ratis. I believe I saw people used GBs files on FileStore. Ratis is also used by Apache Ozone which is supposed to stress Ratis a lot in its use cases.
For such optimizations, usually I think it worths a benchmark to identify the bottleneck and/or provide a baseline to convince people that such optimization is useful, and how much it is useful.
Thanks @elek for reviewing and merging this.  I just noticed that `shaded.protobuf.version` and `shaded.grpc.version` also need to be updated in Ratis to match Ratis Thirdparty: #413.
@adoroszlai , thanks a lot for working on this!
Thanks @szetszwo for reviewing and merging it.
Thanks @adoroszlai for the contribution.  Thanks also @amaliujia for reviewing this.
Thanks @amaliujia and @szetszwo for the review.

@runzhiwang thanks for your comments.

> @amaliujia Thanks the patch. I have two questions:
> 
> 1. Because all peers will be persisted in storage,  what the persisted data looks like when add listener ? I doubt whether we can identify listener when restart the cluster.

Can you point the place that persist peers to storage to me? Sounds like we need to differentiate normal peer and listener in  the persisted data. At least in a RaftGroup we have a way to differentiate two kinds of servers. Generally speaking we need an extra bit to indicate a server is a listener.

But this is a good point about still making listener work even when restarting the cluster.

> 2. Do we need to forbit normal peers sending RequestVote to listener ?

I think forbidding listener participant voting greatly simplify the implementation while allowing listener join voting seems have no much benefits. One benefit I can think of is listener can help reject candidate whose log might be lagging behind. But the cost is the increasing algorithmic complexity. E.g. need to re-consider majority votes, should listener be counted or not?

> Can you point the place that persist peers to storage to me? 

see `writeRaftConfiguration`

> Do we need to forbit normal peers sending RequestVote to listener ?

Sorry, I did not make it clear. Your patch is listener reject vote,  but I think any candidate should not send RequestVote to listener.

> Sorry, I did not make it clear. Your patch is listener reject vote, but I think any candidate should not send RequestVote to listener.

Ah the code in this PR is more likely a defensive check. 

In this PR the candidate actually does not send the RequestVote to listeners. See [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-ratis/blob/7d0ecb19c692619a992cd7c07adb3d64fbde9ca0/ratis-server/src/main/java/org/apache/ratis/server/impl/LeaderElection.java#L276). Basically `getOtherPeers` won't fetch listeners. Also remove that check will change nothing in this PR.

> In this PR the candidate actually does not send the RequestVote to listeners. See here. Basically getOtherPeers won't fetch listeners. Also remove that check will change nothing in this PR.

Thanks, got it.
@adoroszlai Thanks the patch. I have merged it.
@elek Thanks the patch. @adoroszlai @amaliujia Thanks for review. I have merged the patch.
@elek Could you help review this ? Thanks a lot.
+1 thanks for this fix!
@szetszwo @amaliujia Thanks for review. I have merged it.
The flaky test shouldn't be related to this PR since no code is changed.
Thanks @runzhiwang for reviewing and committing it.
cc @szetszwo @runzhiwang for review and any ideas on why the leader enters a closed state and adding peers to the configuration fails in the integration test.
@adoroszlai Thanks the patch. I have merged it.

The added integration test `InstallSnapshotNotificationTests#testInstallSnapshotNotificationCount` shows two log lines from the leader (s2 in this example):
```log
[s2@group-DF2C3007074F-SegmentedRaftLogWorker] INFO  RaftServer$Division (ServerState.java:close(405)) - s2@group-DF2C3007074F: closes. applyIndex: 20
[s2@group-DF2C3007074F-SegmentedRaftLogWorker] INFO  segmented.SegmentedRaftLogWorker (SegmentedRaftLogWorker.java:close(236)) - s2@group-DF2C3007074F-SegmentedRaftLogWorker close()
```
When it tries to add two new nodes to the cluster later in the test, `RaftServerTestUtil#waitAndCheckNewConf`  fails because s2 thinks it is the leader, but it is closed so the rest of the cluster has elected a new leader, and the check deems the configuration unstable.  It looks like s2 could have closed because of the `java.lang.IllegalStateException: lastWrittenIndex == 19, entry == term: 2 index: 21`  which occurred on s2 when trying to push the new configuration. This is probably due to how the logs are being truncated and purged, but I have not found the exact cause.
Thanks @runzhiwang for reviewing and merging it.
Done in 0bdf24f3e307246e5dcaefac03e41c9fb69a6ef1, I think this can be closed.

@errose28 , I just have tried the test.  The two new servers, s3 and s4, have failed to start due to "Unexpected gap in segments" as shown below.  It seems the changes might have some bug.
```
2021-02-10 15:32:49,699 [s4@group-9F91CFE6147C-StateMachineUpdater] ERROR impl.StateMachineUpdater (StateMachineUpdater.java:run(189)) - s4@group-9F91CFE6147C-StateMachineUpdater caught a Throwable.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unexpected gap in segments: binarySearch(20) returns -1, segments=[log-21_21]
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.segmented.SegmentedRaftLogCache$LogSegmentList.purge(SegmentedRaftLogCache.java:340)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.segmented.SegmentedRaftLogCache.purge(SegmentedRaftLogCache.java:559)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.segmented.SegmentedRaftLog.purgeImpl(SegmentedRaftLog.java:362)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.RaftLogBase.purge(RaftLogBase.java:307)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.impl.StateMachineUpdater.takeSnapshot(StateMachineUpdater.java:292)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.impl.StateMachineUpdater.checkAndTakeSnapshot(StateMachineUpdater.java:255)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.impl.StateMachineUpdater.run(StateMachineUpdater.java:178)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
2021-02-10 15:32:49,699 [s3@group-9F91CFE6147C-StateMachineUpdater] ERROR impl.StateMachineUpdater (StateMachineUpdater.java:run(189)) - s3@group-9F91CFE6147C-StateMachineUpdater caught a Throwable.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unexpected gap in segments: binarySearch(20) returns -1, segments=[log-21_21]
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.segmented.SegmentedRaftLogCache$LogSegmentList.purge(SegmentedRaftLogCache.java:340)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.segmented.SegmentedRaftLogCache.purge(SegmentedRaftLogCache.java:559)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.segmented.SegmentedRaftLog.purgeImpl(SegmentedRaftLog.java:362)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.RaftLogBase.purge(RaftLogBase.java:307)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.impl.StateMachineUpdater.takeSnapshot(StateMachineUpdater.java:292)
	at org.apache.ratis.server.impl.StateMachineUpdater.checkAndTakeSnapshot(StateMachineUpdater.java:255)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
```
New integration test is passing. Ready for review. Current CI failure looks unrelated.
Just have reopened this for triggering a new build.  Will wait for it.

BTW, we should migrate the podling from the Incubator to the TLP before the release; see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/RATIS-1316

@runzhiwang, it should be easy for the releases.  We only have to remove DISCLAIMER file and make sure the artifact names do not contain "incubator" anymore.  The website and other changes can be done later.

@runzhiwang , thanks a lot for working on this.  There are a few other "incubator" or "incubating" found in make_rc.sh.
```
-- ./dev-support/make_rc.sh ---------------------------------------------------
 82:   svn co https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/incubator/ratis "$SVNDISTDIR"
119:   tar zvxf "$projectdir/ratis-assembly/target/apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}-src.tar.gz"
120:   cd "apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}"
130:   cp "$WORKINGDIR/apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}/ratis-assembly/target/apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}-bin.tar.gz" "apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}-bin.tar.gz"
131:   cp "$projectdir/ratis-assembly/target/apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}-src.tar.gz" "apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}-src.tar.gz"
182:    10. (If the vote passed): Send out the next voting mail to the incubator mailing list.
```

```
-- ./dev-support/make_rc.sh ---------------------------------------------------
 82:   svn co https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/incubator/ratis "$SVNDISTDIR"
119:   tar zvxf "$projectdir/ratis-assembly/target/apache-ratis-incubating-${RATISVERSION}-src.tar.gz"

182:    10. (If the vote passed): Send out the next voting mail to the incubator mailing list.
```

@szetszwo  Hi, line 119, 120, 130, 131 already changed in this PR. line 82 need to change dir, if we remove incubator, the dir will be https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/ratis, which does not exist.
@runzhiwang , I just have created https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/ratis/  and copied KEYS to there.

>  I just have created https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/ratis/ and copied KEYS to there.

Yes, we should put the 2.0.0 release to the new dir.  For the old releases, we will move them once we have fixed the links in the web pages.

According to https://github.com/apache/ratis/blob/master/ratis-docs/themes/ratisdoc/static/js/bootstrap.min.js , we are using
 Bootstrap v3.4.1 so that we should set the years to 2011-2019.

BTW, please also add v3.4.1.  Thanks.

@runzhiwang , as a summary, we should have the following changes:
```
+++ b/LICENSE
@@ -237,8 +237,8 @@ OF SUCH DAMAGE.
 
 --
 
-Bootstrap
----------
+Bootstrap v3.4.1
+----------------
 The product bundles Bootstrap in these paths:
 
 ratis-docs/themes/ratisdoc/static/css/bootstrap*
@@ -247,8 +247,8 @@ which is licensed under MIT
 
 The MIT License (MIT)
 
-Copyright (c) 2011-2020 Twitter, Inc.
-Copyright (c) 2011-2020 The Bootstrap Authors
+Copyright (c) 2011-2019 Twitter, Inc.
+Copyright (c) 2011-2019 The Bootstrap Authors
 
 Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
 of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
@@ -270,8 +270,8 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
 
 --
 
-JQuery
-------
+JQuery v3.4.1
+-------------
 The product bundles JQuery in
 ratis-docs/themes/ratisdoc/static/js/jquery-3.4.1.min.js
 which is licensed under MIT
```

It seems like tests with the simulated RPC are failing pretty often, regardless of code changes under test.  I'm not yet familiar with all of these test suites.  It doesn't look related to this patch, but what do long-time committers think?  Are the simulated RPC tests just flaky?

I just have checked a few past builds.  TestRaftReconfigurationWithGrpc (failed) and TestNettyDataStreamChainTopologyWithGrpcCluster (timeout 100 seconds) did fail often.

The simulated RPC tests look okay.
@cnauroth , you are right that the failed tests do not seem related.  I just have merged this.  Thanks a lot for your contribution!
The failed tests do not seem related.  Will merge this soon.
